level.text: Petitions for reconsideration, rehearing, reargument, or stay of a decision or order of the Board filed pursuant to D.C. Official Code ยง 25-433(d) shall be typewritten on letter-sized (8.5″ x 11″) paper and double-spaced.
An original and six (6) legible copies of the Petition shall be filed with the Board, and a copy shall be served on each party and intervenor.
A petition for reconsideration shall state briefly the matters of record alleged to have been erroneously decided, the grounds relied upon, and the relief sought.

If a petition is based in whole or in part on a new matter, that matter shall be set forth in an affidavit and be accompanied by a statement that the petitioner could not by due diligence have known or discovered the new matter prior to the date the case was presented to the Board for decision.
The Board may, in its discretion, permit or require oral argument upon a petition filed under this section.
